fields.description:
We have somewhat flexible ship dates, as the content of our SW release is fixed at the beginning of a sprint.  We also cannot "release" a version until all the work is done (we aren't allowed to defer work to another revision).  Therefore, it is important for stakeholders to see the impact of "extra" work in the sprint due to overloading up front (how late did we end up relative to plan).

We'd like to have the hour-burndown show this by keeping the red guideline fixed to the planned "end date", but allow the chart to include dates to the right after the planned end date out to our actual "release date".  

In 5.7.1, the version "release date" has no impact on the charting capabilities, only the "end date" is used, and the guideline burndown is fixed to it.
fields.summary: Allow chart board to display guideline to planned end date, but work out to a later release date

fields.description:
We need to have ability to use Kanban board. The main idea is to see something like on the first page of the "Kanban and Scrum - making the most of both" book.

http://www.infoq.com/minibooks/kanban-scrum-minibook.

There are exact requriements.

1. We need to limit tickets count for the not finished and finished tickets in one number. Like on the picture. Now haven't this ability and have to put two numbers in two columns. So we have to create two columns for each stage (for example "Planning" and "Planning Done", "Development" and "Development Done") and limit maximum count of tickets on each of them. This makes desicion of setting that limitations more complexity and our working process on issues less obvious.
There is two options of solving this problem
* to have one limit for two columns(like in the book)
or
* to have ability to see any indication on ticket that it is done on this stage. So we do not need to create two colulms for each stage.

Second option looks like more simple for implementation.
2. We need to see definitions of done (DoD) for each stage on the board.
3. We need to see metric "lead time" on the board or in other place.
4. We need to see indication of capacity exceeding for the stage even if we use filtration by user.

Can we expect the implementation of this features?
fields.summary: Kanban Taskboard Improvements
document changes to column config for 5.8.3

fields.description: Our work items may have different "weight" depending on the column they're in.  For example, we have a work item type that is very easy for development (1/10 the dev work that other items are) but is the same work for QA and Operations as other work items.  We've found the best way to do that is to be able to configure the column constraints differently for each column, based on a separate field (such as Story Points, or Work Item Weight, or whatever).  So we want to configure one column for a constraint of 3 "Work Item Weights" but the next column for a constraint of 5 items.  We can do this today in that old fashioned task board, but were disappointed to find it unavailable in the newfangled Rapid Board.  We're stuck using both, for different things (sigh).
fields.summary: Ability to set column constraints separately for each column (and by other fields, not just item count)

fields.description:
Currently there is no method to navigate to a full page view of an issue from Rapid Board.  Clicking on any issue only allows it to show on the right of the browser.  The current around is to right-click an issue and open it in a new tab/window.

There should be an "View Issue" button (maybe next to the 'Hide Details') to allow for a full issue view.
fields.summary: There's no apparent way to get to the "full screen view" of an issue from the details on the Rapid Board

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA to to see the *remaining* (not total) story points in an epic, you must create a custom filter, you can not simply pull down a chart to do it.

Having this kind of roll up is very valuable to teams working epics.

What doesn't work:

1) Crete a new context based on Epic issue type: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+Contexts+to+Filter+and+Highlight+Issues, this doesn't help because it just shows the total points, it doesn't show the time remaining on a  per epic issue.

2) use the task board: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Working+with+Epics, that doesn't help either because again, it does not show the time remaining per epic.

We need a way to see a chart that shows the time remaining per epic, not per version.

The awkward work around; if you use a burndown chart with a custom filter for a specific epic name, then yes you can see the time remaining for that epic, but only for that epic...if your project hs several epics having to manually create this filter all the time (as new epics are created) is not practical.

We need a way to see a chart that shows the time remaining per epic.
fields.summary: as a user I need to see the *remaining* story points in an epic

fields.description: Currently the GreenHopper Agile Gadget will only show unreleased versions. We would like it so released versions can also be selected. The goal is to be able to use the GreenHopper Agile Gadget and embed it on a Confluence page in order to show a projects history.
fields.summary: Provide option to display released versions with the GreenHopper Agile Gadget

fields.description:
If a user Edits an issue and removes a parent fix version from an issue and not one of the sub-versions, then the Greenhopper Fix Version Synchronizer will by design undo the removal of the parent fix version before updating the issue.

It would be great if some message were conveyed to the user after the update as to what happened or perhaps conveyed to the user right when they remove the parent version.

Right now many of our users cannot figure out why they can't remove the parent version without removing the sub-version and they do it repeatedly and then report it to the Jira admins as a bug.
fields.summary: Give users a message when they attempt to remove a parent fix version without removing a sub-version of that parent version

fields.description:
On the following screens of GH
Task Board
Planning Board
Released Board
Chart Board
Clicking on 'Create Issue' link results in Error Dialog.
Error dialog says 
""status-code":500,"message":"Can not deserialize instance of java.util.ArrayList out of VALUE_STRING token\n at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@b5b58a; line: 1, column: 21]"}"
fields.summary: Clicking on 'Create Issue' from GH screens results in 500 Error.

fields.description: When the customer clicks on the Agile > Planning Board he wants to be redirect directly to the "Project Overview" screen.
fields.summary: Ability to set a default screen when click on Agile > Planning Board

fields.description:
In order for rapid board reports to be meaningful, you need to include a column representing the "end" state ("resolved" for example). However, this column is filling up very quickly, which makes the Rapid Board Work view difficult to use when you have more than one swimlane.
Therefore, it should be possible to hide the last column, while maintaining it for reports.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like to hide a column from the board while keeping it for reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-3928].
  {panel}

Develop Tokes' spike to add configurable permissions from plugins 
- Specifically refers to global permissions 
- Needs additional development to work for project permissions 

COS: 
- Code from Spike needs to be reviewed by Spud and Mark Lassau
- Needs to be merged to Jira (either by the Jira team or us) 
- Work needs to go in 5.0 branch for GH
- Define new permission in plugin file and convert our code to use the new permission 
- Build some Jira automated tests for use by the Jira CI
fields.summary: As a GH administrator, I would like the ability to define which groups have the ability to rank issues across project

fields.description:
Change 'Only My Issues', 'Hide Done Issues', 'Hide Sub-tasks' looks when clicked instead of just changing color. The color changed can be subtle to be noticed.

The texts should change e.g. 'Hide Done Issues' changed to 'Show Done Issues' after clicked.
fields.summary: Change 'Only My Issues', 'Hide Done Issues', 'Hide Sub-tasks' looks when clicked

fields.description:
It would be very nice to be able to navigate from an issue on the rapid board to it's detailed (Default) Jira view screen - just like you can do from a card in the Planning and Task Boards.
This should be accessible from both the card itself and from the built-in RapidBoard Detail view.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to go to the detailed issue view from the RapidBoard

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to modify the fields that are displayed in the cards on the RapidBoard, just like you can for the Planing and Task boards.
In particular, it would be nice to be able to show the name of the assignee in addition of their avatar :)

*Please Note* 

This issue relates to configuring the layout of the card on the Rapid Board. If you are instead interested in configuring the fields shown in the detail view that pops up when you click on an issue in the Rapid Board, please see [GHS-3474 - As a Rapid Board user I would like to configure the detail view for an issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3474]


!download.png!



----
Latest update by Tom can be found at [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3922?focusedCommentId=503166&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-503166]
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to configure the cards displayed in the rapid board

fields.description: Currently when we successfully create an issue using the quickcreate, we do not post a success message
fields.summary: As an RB user, I want a success message when I create an issue (link + shortcut)

fields.description:
We should either

1. Put a limit on Rapid View names (which no one wants to do)
2. Or have a smart fade on the title when it becomes long, rather than render the whole thing.
fields.summary: Long Rapid View names distort new Configure Cog + RapidBoard

fields.description: When you delete the last rapidview (leaving you with none), the 'Create a new Rapid View' link on the attached page is broken. Luckily, you can still use the Getting Started link, but we need to fix this.
fields.summary: Create New Rapid View link broken when all rapidviews deleted
Control graphs should show hours if less than 1d

fields.description:
Flagged issues are useful for teams to highlight roadblocks. 

Roadblocks are usually discussed in the daily standup (e.g. frequently).

Would be great to have a quick filter to quickly display Flagged issues.
fields.summary: New Feature Request: Quick Filter for Flagged Issues

fields.description:
In GH you can enable a night service AND version/component sync'ing.

It seems that this sync'ing still takes affect when GH is disabled or expired. This is a PITA because I don't want my versions to keep getting changed on me and I have no way of turning it off since the GH config has disappeared.

This is critical for studio and needs to be fixed before their next release. The work need to be done one the closed branch ondemand-fixes

Original bug is at https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-903
fields.summary: When GH is expired/disabled via ondemand license GH configuration still is in effect
As a Rapid Board user, I'm a bit confused about the two Cogs on the Rapid Board view and would like to be able to differentiate the "Actions" Cog from the "Release" process

fields.description:
Use case:
We have a browser session open with a tab for each project context, this is saved as a browser session. When reopened the project context defaults to the last project context selected, in this case one is left with a bunch of open tabs for the same assignee. If one uses a tab reloader when each tab is activated then the project context just keeps bouncing to the last selected on a tab.

Can the web service be updated to include an project context reference in the URL to avoids this happening?

I made a similar request to have the assignee added to the url GHS-3293
fields.summary: Task board - add the project context to the url

fields.description: It gets very tedious to change date ranges for iterations/sprints/versions. The thing is, when some date reconsideration is made on the iterations, I must rearrange the start date, the end date and even the release date of the version for all current versions. It would be nice if all versions would just automatically ajust according to a date change or by entering the number of days an iteration will last.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to enter the number of days when creating an iteration so that the end date can ajust automatically with the start date

fields.description:
When experimenting with the RapidBoard I would like to use the new clone RapidBoard functionality to try out some ideas for my RapidBoards. From there I want to quickly edit the existing Filter but I may not own it, so I'd like the ability to copy the existing filter (automatically giving it a unique name and copying the Share permissions). From there I can edit the Filter as normal. 

- The UI for this needs to be given some thought by Jay
fields.summary: As an experimenting RapidBoard user, I would like to be able to quickly clone the Saved Filter for a rapid board to a new filter so I can change the issues shown without going in to Jira land

fields.description:
COS:
- In the configuration screen for a RapidView I should be able to select a filter to be used instead of the existing one
fields.summary: As a new Rapid Board User, I would like to be able to change filters of a rapid board so I can copy someone elses and make changes

fields.description:
COS:
- Cog is offered in the Rapid Board view and the Rapid Board Configuration screen, the cog produces a drop down which allows the user to access "New", "Delete", "Configure" - Not sure if "Release" goes in here from the online view (Martin/Jay to comment). Users that cannot edit the Rapid Board can only use the Configure option to view the configuration
- Delete option shows a confirmation dialog first
fields.summary: As a new user, I'd like to be able to access quickly find and try out operations on RapidBoards view without having to go searching

fields.description: Required for gadgets.
fields.summary: As a GH dev I want to have the JS for the RB split into individually loadable components

fields.description: At the moment Ctrl-Click (Win) or Cmd-Click (Mac) is overloaded as normal to bring up the quick view of the issue details, can this work normally?
fields.summary: As a FF/Chrome user, I would like Ctrl-Click or Cmd-Click (on Mac) to open the issue on a new tab when I click on the issue link on a card

fields.description: Check whether the user might have rank permission (at all) and don't allow any interactivity in that case
fields.summary: Rapid View List should not allow ranking if the user can't possibly rank

fields.description: RankCustomFieldServiceImpl.getDefaultRankField should check that the id it gets out of propertyDao is an id for an existing custom field, rather than return null if no such custom field exists.
fields.summary: As a GH admin I want GH to gracefully handle the case where I delete the default rank custom field

fields.description:
As per conversation with Nick and Michael, we want to clean up the JS so that our pages behave in a predictable and non-flakey manner. This will allow us to improve our automated tests and make them in turn less flakey. This in turn will allow us to have meaningful build information. When a test fails, it should be a definitive failure and not one due to flakey JS/flakey tests.

Conditions for Development:
We won't start this until our tested browsers are upgraded to Chrome + FF latest

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# View a rapid view with ranking enabled but issues present which you do not have permission to rank
# Select multiple issues
# Attempt to rank those issues

Outcome:
* Issues are not ranked (good), but
* Your selection is dropped to just one issue

I would expect that the multi-issue selection is maintained, even though the ranking operation failed.
fields.summary: Multi-issue selection is lost if ranking operation fails on Rapid Board

fields.description:
Not sure if this is reproducible, or if it was specific to the blitz environment.

The administrator of the instance had links to *Configure* all the rapid views in the instance, even though it had no ability to actually configure anything about the rapid views.

For other users of the system, the link displayed was labelled *View Configuration* instead, which is clearer.
fields.summary: Administrator still sees "Configure" link in Manage Rapid Views page, even though he wasn't able to configure anything about the Rapid View

fields.description:
This one isn't very obvious, but something I came across.

If I have two issues:
* ABC-123 - a normal issue, which is ranked higher than
* ABC-456 - a parent issue with some sub-tasks

If I convert ABC-123 to be a sub-task of ABC-456, what should the ranking of ABC-123 be in relation to ABC-456's existing sub-tasks? At the moment, it becomes the lowest ranked child of ABC-456. But since it was ranked _above_ the parent previously, should it not become the _highest_ ranked sub-task?
fields.summary: Should higher ranking of an issue be preserved if converting it to a sub-task of a lower issue?

fields.description:
If I have two projects:
* One which I have permission to rank in (e.g. *Project A*)
* One which I don't (e.g. *Project B*)

And I display both those projects on a Rapid View, I can 
* rank an issue from *Project A* above an issue from *Project B*, but I _cannot_;
* rank the same issue from *Project B* below the same issue from *Project A*.

It seems odd that although I can achieve the same outcome, I can successfully do it one way but not the other.
fields.summary: Rank permissions in a multi-project environment don't seem to make sense

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Get a rapid view which is rankable but contains issues from a project which you do not have permission to rank
# Multi-select issues from both a project you can rank and a project you cannot
# Use the mouse to rank those selected issues

Outcome:
* A warning is displayed saying that you do not have permission to rank the issues;
* Yet the issues which you were allowed to rank have successfully been ranked

It's a bit confusing - my initial thought was that the entire operation should have been aborted.
fields.summary: Ranking multiple issues with multi-select when some are "rankable" and some aren't still ranks the rankable ones but then displays a warning message

fields.description:
Hi we found that that the GH statistics burndown chart works ok for Daily, well except that its completely unreadable because you can't zoom the graph,but aside from that it basically works.  However if you group by Children, then it doesn't work.  Basically its only counting the story points for issues which were explicitly marked with a Fix Version of one of the children and not also including:

- those marked with the parent version
- those closed in the same date range as a child version and marked with the parent version.

Here is an example scenario:

So, lets say I make a parent version 1.0.0 and I then make a child version 1.0.1, and the start date for 1.0.1 is Jan 1st, and its ;end date is Jan 3rd.

Now lets say I create a story with 4 points, and I closed it on Jan 2nd, and I set the Fix Version (when I close) to be 1.0.1 (the child version).

If I now go to the statistics burndown chart and group by children, it shows zero points left. Perfect! All good.

But...if I instead do this:

    open the story with 4 points
    on Jan 2nd close it, and set Fix Version to 1.0.0 (the parent version)
    go to tteh statistics burndown chart and group by children.

It will show 4 points remaining.

We believe what is happening is that even though the documentation says that the grouping is by custom time segments (i.e. jan 1st to the jan 3rd), this is not actually how the chart works.

Instead the chart is only collecting into a child bar, the stories that were explicitly set to that version.

We tested in our instance of JIRA and we found that this is how the chart is working.

Why this is wrong:

1) the daily chart isn't working like that, so its inconsistent.

2) if you manage a large team, getting all 200 designers to properly select
the explicit Fix Version for the child sprint is (in theory) correct, but
not practical. Policing all 200 designers every day is just not practical.

When grouping by children, it should include in child versions issues that were either closed during the same time period for the sprint (presuming they have at least the right parent version).

If you have sub-teams working on different parent versions at the same time, then you can't just pick the stories that were closed within the same time range as a sub-version, they might be completely unrelated! But if the users at least set the fix version to parent version (giving you enough context), then the the child-versions should be inferred from their date ranges and when the story was closed.

This would ensure that that statistics burndown chart would show the same value sin both daily and children views.

For this particular issue; we have exactly this case, all of the designers closed the stories during sprints, but for whatever reason, many of them closed the stories with the parent version instead of the exact sprint version. So the daily chart works fine, but the children chart is busted, because it isn't being smart enough to match up the dates when the stories were closed with the child versions.

It should be able to do that because the Fix version was set to the parent version, so the tool should have enough context to know which sub-versions to map to.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Statistics Burndown (Grouped By Children) Should be Date Aware

fields.description:
If you have 2 custom fields with that have the same name, and you also have a filter that orders by one of these, we don't allow you to rank with that field. However, changing the filter to use the id of the field rather than the name STILL doesn't fix the problem, and actually rewrites the filter to use the name....

Steps to reproduce:
* Add a new custom field called Rank of type Global Rank (not sure type matters)
* Go to the board configuration tab
* Click to edit the filter
* JIRA actually saves the filter with the name rather than the field ID :(
fields.summary: Filter changes from Rank ID to Rank name when there is a duplicate field preventing us from ranking

fields.description: We need a tool to compare the differences between datasets. It will make it easier to find expected and unexpected changes to our data, be it with ranking, releases, issues, rapidviews, or filters. It might also give us a better way to test by testing against an expected diff.
